page.title: 11Interview: local resident
page.content: Mr. Tucker interview continued. At school he had to take a packed lunch, mainly sandwiches and cheese. At the school there was a watering-can full of water which you could drink from. If you forgot your packed lunch you would have to go without a meal. When Mr. Tucker left school he went to work on a farm which he enjoyed alot. In his job he got paid half-a-crown a week. When he was young he enjoyed football and swimming in the river. He has seen many changes in the area. Some were for the better and some were not. In the holidays he spent his time at home and down in the village park. He, too, can remember the queen as a princess staying at Castle Hill.
